text.paragraph: Radiology Reports

tr.td: CT LDCT For Lung Ca Screen

item.paragraph: (CT LDCT For Lung Ca Screen) Reason For Exam: Former Smoker Quit W/In 15 Yr;Age 50 With 20Pk Yr Hx Smoking +1 Risk

paragraph.content:
CLINICAL INFORMATION: FORMER SMOKER QUIT W/IN 15 YR age 68
EXAMINATION: CT Thorax without intravenous contrast, Lung Cancer Screening3/16/2020 11:30 AM, CT200043025
COMPARISON: CT dated 2013-08-09
FINDINGS:
TECHNIQUE: Cross sectional imaging was performed with a slice thickness of 1.25 mm from the thoracic inlet to the lung bases without the use of intravenous contrast. Low-dose protocol was utilized with 120 kV and 16 mA.
Vascular: The thoracic aorta is normal in caliber. Calcific plaque is seen within the aorta and coronary vessels
Lungs: Diffuse emphysema.
Nodules: No suspicious nodules. Small spiculated density left lower lobe superior segment is stable when compared to prior study from 2012. Lesion may represent a small AVM with draining vein. Small calcified granuloma seen in the left lung apex.
Thoracic Lymph Nodes: No enlarged thoracic lymph nodes are identified.
Pleura: There are no pleural plaques or nodules identified. No pleural effusion is present.
Cardiac: The heart is normal in size. There are coronary calcifications.
Mediastinum: No mediastinal masses are identified. Thoracic spondylosis.
IMPRESSION:
1. Negative lung cancer screening exam. ACR Lung RADS category 2
2. Follow-up screening recommended in one year
3. Severe emphysema.
4. Atherosclerosis with coronary artery disease.
5. Chronic granulomatous disease.
6. Stable opacity superior segment of the left lower lobe may represent a small vascular malformation with draining vein.
Dose Range Report. CTDIvol: 1.7 mGy, DLP: 68 mGy-cm
All CT scans at this facility use dose modulation, iterative reconstruction, and/or weight based dosing when appropriate to reduce radiation dose to as low as reasonably achievable
This report was dictated at Workstation ID: PLA2131

Dictation Date/Time: 2020-12-16 11:56 am
Dictating Radiologist : Hansen Jr, Dale E, MD
Signing Radiologist : Hansen Jr, Dale E, MD
Final Signed Date/Time: 2020-12-16 11:52 am
****** Final Electronic Signature Line *******
